intro: Amylotheca triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered amylotheca, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters of three, giving it its common name. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Amylotheca triflora is typically found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates.
